managementResponses.response:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We are glad you enjoyed your stay at Adante Hotel. We do apologize for this error sir and we do try our best to accommodate every guest. We hope you enjoyed the city and we will take this feedback for future reference. We wish to see you in the future and we hope you have a nice day.

review.title: Convenient for everywhere I needed to go.
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, I was pointed in the nearest and cheapest overnight parking. They were then able to get me early check in, but put me in a room that had not been cleaned yet. They were quick to fix this error. Staff were super friendly, especially Marissa. Easy to get to, from the North Bay. And easy to get out of town as well once my shenanigans were done. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Decent hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a pleasant experience at this hotel. Decent accomodations, excellent location and the staff were excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and plenty of restuarants, bars, stores ect. Excellent location

review.reviewText: Great location, bus at front door.  Woman at desk took care of everything.

review.title: Good location & friendly service
review.reviewText: Good location, clean & comfortable, friendly & helpful service, basic breakfast.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Met expectations for the price in Central San Francisco at a peak period.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast seating arrangements, cramped and uncomfortable. Street parking arrangements poor.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square close by and entertaining

review.title: Small and quaint
review.reviewText: You definitely pay for what you get, but the. Again that is ALL of San Francisco. My room was tiny little room to move around but the bed made up for it in comfort. The location is on the edge of the scary part of town but didn't really mind. If you don't have a car ( I recommend  you  don't bother) most uber rides to all your main tourist  attractionspots were only 7-10 per ride, airport about 30. I would stay here again, was budget  friendly and the Mediterranean restaurant  downstairs  is a must try.
Convenient location but too too small!!! Friendly staff. Tiny area for breakfast and not enough space to sit. Room is cleaning but it can get too hot and can't open the windows.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for staying with us and for you feedback. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

review.title: Tight space for 2 queen beds
review.reviewText: It's a small hotel with tiny rooms, especially tight with 2 queen beds. There's no loading/unloading zone, but there is a parking garage just a couple doors away. The lobby is fresh, but the rooms and bathrooms are dated. The rooms have radiators but no A/C. The attached Egyptian/Mediterranean restaurant is good and is open until midnight.

managementResponses.response: Rachael, We strive to provide our guests with flawless service and product delivery. Our apologies that we did not live up to your expectations. We were very distressed to learn of your first impression of the hotel. We've brought your feedback to our room service staff's attention. While we are glad that we were able to get you another room, we sincerely apologize for your inconvenience. We understand that you did not have a favorable impression of our hotel, but we sincerely hope you'll give us another opportunity to restore your confidence in our hotel and hospitality. Thanks again for your feedback Rachael.

review.title: Hate to say that I wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: Maybe this is normal for SF, but it was my first time in the city. The room was over fragranced (bad for allergies), the room is shockingly small (and I live in Seattle), and the staff didn't remember me 5 minutes after check-in. I was upgraded, so I at least appreciate their effort to make my stay better. And it was pretty in the lobby area.

managementResponses.response: We are so pleased that we could be your host during your recent visit to San Francisco. Professional customer service and comfortable rooms with great amenities are always what we strive for and I'm so pleased to hear that we achieved our goal your visit. Thanks for your stellar review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Found this hotel by accident upon arrival in San Fran. Ended up staying a second night. Hotel taff was excellent, hotel had quite the character. Absolutely recommend.

managementResponses.response: Lorena, thank you for staying with us and for your feedback. Since we are in a highly desired location street parking is tough. We do have a convenient parking garage right next door for our guests. We hope you'll give us another chance. Thank you!

review.title: Shocked in Frisco
review.reviewText: As you find the hotel, there's no parking to be found, unless you pay for valet ($50) or Public Overnight Parking ($32). Rooms are very small, but clean, and walls are paper thin. I would not recommend this hotel.

managementResponses.response: Sharon, thank you for your thorough review. As a frequent traveler myself, I completely agree with you that it is good to have a little time to check-out, so we don't feel rushed out. I am really happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Next time you're in town and need a place to stay, just give us a call.

review.title: Decent hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to union square just like other reviewers say. Not a good location but then again you have to remember that hotels in cities are usually next to small restaurants, liquor stores, or bars. If your looking for a safe area then pay extra to stay at Hilton or another big chain hotel. The room is small but you get your own bathroom and the bed was comfy. This hotel is good if you plan on staying 1- 2 nights more than that stay somewhere else so you'll be comfortable. The lobby is nice and modern but everything else is older looking (the stairs, the carpet in the rooms/ hallway). We didn't hear any outside noise or neighbors so we slept comfortably. We only stayed one night for a romantic getaway since we only live 40mins away. we took Bart not sure where you would park your car if you drove. We did a little research and parking overnight is anywhere between $35 and $50.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked how check out time is noon. For once we didn't feel like we had to rush to get out of there.

managementResponses.response:
Glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay overall. We apologize for the cable. Please know that we have taken care of this issue. We hope to welcome you back again next time you visit San Francisco. 
Thank you for your review!

review.title: Nice:)
review.reviewText: Good staff:) It's just that the TV cable not working.

managementResponses.response: Glad you enjoyed the location. Hope you had a wonderful time in San Francisco. Thank you for your review!

review.title: close to anyplace
review.reviewText: in the heart of the city and easy to access to anywhere in downtown SF.

managementResponses.response: Glad to see you liked our hotel and found the location as well as the staff to be wonderful. Hope to welcome you back again soon!

review.title: Convenient location, comfortable, friendly staff.
review.reviewText: This  an old hotel that has been updated. Our room was quite cramped by a large dresser-desk.

managementResponses.response: Dear Natasha, guests love our location since it is central and accessible to best things city has to offer. Although, it is true and unfortunate that like many major cities, our city also has homelessness issues, but we assure you that it is safe especially towards Union Square area, which is always filled with energy. We hope you will give us another opportunity. Thank you.

review.title: DONT DO IT
review.reviewText:
We walked in and straight back out. Forfeited the first nights rate to just get out of that area and find somewhere else!!! 
The area in one word: ghetto.

managementResponses.response: Hi Julie, we  are delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay with us. Sorry about the hangers. This is very unlike of our staff. Please know that we have brought this to our staff's attention to ensure this does not happen again. We hope to welcome you back again. Thank you for your review.

review.title: Good hotel for the money
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights in June. It was a great base to stay and everything is within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and had a comfortable bed. They provided a free breakfast which had everything you would expect.
review.negativeRemarks: We requested more hangers for the wardrobe as we only had 2 but they never appeared.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a great base for sightseeing however there is a lot of homeless people in the area.

managementResponses.response: Dear guest, we try very hard to make our guests stays as pleasant as possible and it is always a disappointment when we learn one of them has left with a less than first-rate experience. The service you described here is not at all acceptable. Please know that we are bringing your experience to our front desk team's attention and we will make sure that this does not happen again. Once again our sincere apologies.

review.reviewText: yawed at by counter staff upon entering front area covered with ceiling deconstructed on the flooring.  Trainee couldn't figure out how get me a receipt for my parking, fine get it, but the trainer decided to go and use the restroom mid conversation and I was left needing to leave to the airport with out receiving documentation of my purchase.

managementResponses.response: It is great to see that everything was to your liking! We hope this means that you'll stay with us again soon. Thank you for your review Steve.

review.title: Close to everything downtown.
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to Union square, cable cars,and Bart. The staff were especially nice. They gave great directions to local attractions. Room was small but really comfortable.

managementResponses.response: Dear Dianne, it appears that we did not have any rooms available on the floors close to the main floor. We sincerely apologize of the elevator being out of order during your stay. We understand it must have caused a great inconvenience. There was a technical issue we encountered. Our technician recommended that elevator stays closed until new part is received and installed. We ordered the part right away but it took a few days for us to receive the new part. That same day we installed the new part and elevator is now fixed and fully functional. Please accept our sincere apologies for your experience. We hope you'll give us another opportunity to restore your confidence in our hotel and our hospitality. Thanks you, Dianne.

review.title: Fawlty Towers
review.reviewText:
70 yr old couple. Given room on 5 th floor when lift was broken. Staff couldn't even get luggage up the stairs!!
Lift out of order, orange juice machine out of order, printer broken. Old guy in reception couldn't have gone any slower or got more things wrong. Chaos reigned constantly and the right hand didn't know what the left hand was doing. Lots of people asking for room changes. Awful hotel, tho good location
